doc.previous: Work on the project began in 2005 and concluded in 2010.[106] The project's cost is estimated at $150Â million. The federal government is paying 65Â percent, Oregon and Washington are paying $27Â million each, and six local ports are also contributing to the cost.[103][107]
doc.after: In 1902, the United States Bureau of Reclamation was established to aid in the economic development of arid western states.[110] One of its major undertakings was building Grand Coulee Dam to provide irrigation for the 600Â thousand acres (2,400Â km2) of the Columbia Basin Project in central Washington.[111] With the onset of World War II, the focus of dam construction shifted to production of hydroelectricity. Irrigation efforts resumed after the war.
